oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Comparison of extraction methods for analysis of flavonoids in onions
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Soeltoft, Malene
Knuthsen, Pia
Nielsen, John
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Production systems
Food security, food quality and human health
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Onions are known to contain high levels of flavonoids and a comparison of the efficiency, reproducibility and detection limits of various extraction methods has been made in order to develop fast and reliable analytical methods for analysis of flavonoids in onions. Conventional and classical methods are time- and solvent-consuming and the presence of light and oxygen during sample preparation facilitate degradation reactions. Thus, classical methods were compared with microwave (irradiation) extraction, ultrasonic liquid extraction and accelerated solvent extraction.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Soeltoft, Malene; Knuthsen, Pia and Nielsen, John (2008) Comparison of extraction methods for analysis of flavonoids in onions. In: Polyphenol Communications, 1.
